abstract.text: TileStore manages downloads and storage for requests to tile-related API endpoints, enforcing a disk usage
quota: tiles available on disk may be deleted to make room for a new download. This interface can be used by an
app developer to set the disk quota. The rest of TileStore API is intended for native SDK consumption only.
Allows observing a tile store’s activity
Sets additional options for this instance.
These constants can be used as keys for TileStore::setOption to configure further aspects of a TileStore instance.
Describes tile store usage modes.
An overloaded version of
with a callback for feedback.
On successful tile region removal, the given callback is invoked with the removed tile region.
Otherwise, the given callback is invoked with an error.
Clears the ambient cache data.
Interactive, thoroughly customizable maps for iOS powered by vector tiles and Metal.
Holds options for the tile region estimation operation.
Tile cache budget in megabytes.
Describes the tile region load option values.
An overloaded version that does not report progess or finished status of the loading operation.
Various options needed for tile cover.
Represents a tile coordinate.
Describes the tileset descriptor option values.
Describes the reason for a tile region download request failure.
Describes the reason for a cache clearing failure.
Describes a cache clearing error.
Describes the tiles data domain.
Callback Invoked to report the progess of the tile region loading operation.
Fetch a tile region’s associated geometry
Options for custom geometry tiles.
Fetch a tile region’s associated metadata
Creates a TileStore instance for the given storage path.
Returns a tile region given its id.
TileRegion represents an identifiable geographic tile region with metadata
A bundle that encapsulates tilesets creation for the tile store implementation.
Checks if a tile region with the given id contains all tilesets from all
of the given tileset descriptors.
Creates a TileStore instance at the default location.
TileStore manages downloads and storage for requests to tile-related API endpoints, enforcing a disk usage
quota: tiles available on disk may be deleted to make room for a new download. This interface can be used by an
app developer to set the disk quota. The rest of TileStore API is intended for native SDK consumption only.
Fetch the array of the existing tile regions.
The result of tile region estim
Gets a
instance for the given storage path. Creates a new one
if one doesn’t exist.
Sets additional options for this instance that are specific to a data type.
Describes the reason for a cache clearing failure.
Tile cache budget in tiles.
A tile region’s estimate progress includes counts of the number of resources that have
been estimated and the total number of resources as well as a partial result with the
current estimate, calculated using the data available at the moment.
Removes a tile region.
Returns a shared
instance at the default location. Creates a
new one if one doesn’t yet exist.
A tile region’s load progress includes counts
of the number of resources that have completed downloading
and the total number of resources that are required.
Estimates the storage and transfer size of a tile region.
Loads a new tile region or updates the existing one.
